com.samsung.android.sdk.shealth.tracker

Interface TrackerEventListener


  • public interface TrackerEventListener
    This interface defines event handlers related to your tracker on S Health. Implement event handlers by extending this interface to receive the tracker event. 

     public class MyTracker implements TrackerEventListener {
 
     private TrackerTileManager mTrackerTileManager;
     private static final String MY_TILE_ID = "hello_tile";
 
     public MyTracker() {
         // A default constructor has to be created.
     }
 
     @Override
     public void onCreate(Context context, String trackerId) {
         try {
             mTrackerTileManager = new TrackerTileManager(context);
         } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
             Log.d(LOG_TAG, "IllegalArgumentException occurred");
         }
     }
 
     @Override
     public void onSubscribed(Context context, String trackerId) {
         // User changed the subscription state of your tracker to subscribe
 
         // Post your tracker tile to be shown on the S Health's main screen.
         // Use TRACKER_TILE_TYPE_1 if there is no data yet.
     }
 
     @Override
     public void onUnsubscribed(Context context, String trackerId) {
         // User changed the subscription state of your tracker to unsubscribe.
     }
 
     @Override
     public void onPaused(Context context, String trackerId) {
         // The main screen of S Health went to the background.
         // Stop posting the tracker tile.
     }
 
     @Override
     public void onTileRequested(Context context, String trackerId, String tileId) {
         // The main screen is resumed on the foreground

         // If tileId is null, it means there is no posted tracker tile successfully on the main screen.
         // Post your tracker tile.
         // Use TRACKER_TILE_TYPE_1 if there is no data yet.

         // If there is posted tracker tile already, you can update it with updated data here.
     }
 
     @Override
     public void onTileRemoved(Context context, String trackerId, String tileId) {
         // User removed your posted tracker tile from the main screen.
     }

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        void onCreate(Context context,
              String trackerId)
        Called when a TrackerEventListener instance has been created.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        Parameters:
        context - Context of your application
        trackerId - The created tracker ID

      • onSubscribed

        void onSubscribed(Context context,
                  String trackerId)
        Called when a given tracker has been subscribed. Post your tracker tile in this event handler.

        This is the first point to receive an event from S Health. If user turns on the subscription status of your tracker on S Health, S Health sends an event to your application through this event hander.

        Post a tracker tile in this event handler to show your tracker on the main screen of S Health. If you have no data yet, use TrackerTile.TRACKER_TILE_TYPE_1.

        Since:
        1.0.0
        Parameters:
        context - Context of your application
        trackerId - The subscribed tracker ID

      • onUnsubscribed

        void onUnsubscribed(Context context,
                    String trackerId)
        Called when a given tracker has been unsubscribed.

        If user turns off the subscription status of your tracker on S Health, S Health removes your tracker tile from the main screen and sends an event to your application through this event hander. You do not need to call TrackerTileManager.remove(String, String).

        Since:
        1.0.0
        Parameters:
        context - Context of your application
        trackerId - The unsubscribed tracker ID

      • onTileRequested

        void onTileRequested(Context context,
                     String trackerId,
                     String tileId)
        Called when a given tracker tile is requested such as if the main screen is resumed on the foreground. Post or update your tracker tile on the main screen of S Health in this handler.

        If tileId is null, it means that there is no posted tracker tile successfully on the main screen. Post your tracker tile here. Otherwise, you can update the posted tracker tile.

        When you post or update a tracker tile in this handler, the tile ID has to be set and you can set it as the followings.
        • If you use the same ID with your posted tracker tile, the updated tracker tile will be shown in the same place with the existing posted tracker tile on the main screen of S Health.
        • If you use a new or different ID, the tracker tile is handled as a new one and will be posted newly as the last tile on the main screen.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        Parameters:
        context - Context of your application
        trackerId - The ID of the tracker of the requested tracker tile
        tileId - The requested tracker tile ID

      • onTileRemoved

        void onTileRemoved(Context context,
                   String trackerId,
                   String tileId)
        Called if user removed a given tracker tile from S Health's main screen.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        Parameters:
        context - Context of your application
        trackerId - The ID of the tracker of the removed tracker tile
        tileId - The removed tracker tile ID

      • onPaused

        void onPaused(Context context,
              String trackerId)
        Called when the S Health's main screen is paused because it runs in the background. No more tracker tile can be posted.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        Parameters:
        context - Context of your application
        trackerId - The ID of the tracker of the removed tracker tile
